avalancheActivity.comment: As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind from southerly directions, further wind slabs will form in the course of the day adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. Fresh and somewhat older wind slabs can be released easily or naturally in particular on steep shady slopes at high altitude. The prevalence of avalanche prone locations and likelihood of triggering will increase with altitude. As a consequence of warming during the day more frequent moist loose snow avalanches are to be expected. Mostly the avalanches are medium-sized. Mostly small moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as a consequence of the rain. This applies in particular on very steep slopes. On steep grassy slopes more medium-sized gliding avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Increase in avalanche danger as a consequence of new snow and strong wind. Backcountry touring calls for caution and restraint.

snowpackStructure.comment: Over a wide area 20 to 30 cm of snow will fall above approximately 1500 m. The wind was strong. In places that are protected from the wind wind slabs formed. The weather conditions as the day progresses will give rise to increasing moistening of the snowpack. The rain will give rise to a loss of strength within the snowpack.

tendency.comment: As the day progresses as a consequence of new snow and strong wind there will be an increase in the avalanche danger within the current danger level.

avalancheActivity.comment: As a consequence of warming during the day more moist loose snow avalanches are to be expected. Small and medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are to be expected as a consequence of the rain. On very steep grassy slopes more gliding avalanches are possible. Fresh and somewhat older wind slabs can be released, especially by large additional loads, above approximately 2200 m. The prevalence of the avalanche prone locations will increase with altitude. On steep grassy slopes more medium-sized gliding avalanches are possible.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The danger of moist and wet avalanches will increase during the day. In addition the wind slabs should be taken into account.

snowpackStructure.comment: Over a wide area 2 to 25 cm of snow will fall above approximately 1800 m. The rain will give rise as the day progresses to a loss of strength within the snowpack. The wind was moderate to strong. In the vicinity of peaks wind slabs formed.

tendency.comment: As the day progresses as a consequence of new snow and strong wind there will be an increase in the avalanche danger within the current danger level.
